simple.escp.dom

Class Page

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.escp.dom.Page

  • public class Page
extends java.lang.Object
    DOM class to represent one page. A Page may contains header and footer. A page also has its page number.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Page(java.util.List<Line> content, TextLine[] header, TextLine[] footer, java.lang.Integer pageNumber, java.lang.Integer pageLength)
      Create a new Page.
      Page(Page anotherPage, java.lang.Integer pageLength)
      Create a clone from another Page.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Page

        public Page(Page anotherPage,
    java.lang.Integer pageLength)
        Create a clone from another Page.
        Parameters:
        anotherPage - a Page to clone.
        pageLength - maximum number of lines for this page. Set null for unlimited lines in this page.

      • Page

        public Page(java.util.List<Line> content,
    TextLine[] header,
    TextLine[] footer,
    java.lang.Integer pageNumber,
    java.lang.Integer pageLength)
        Create a new Page.
        Parameters:
        content - the content of this Page.
        header - the header for this Page. Set null if this page doesn't have header.
        footer - the footer for this Page. Set null if this page doesn't have footer.
        pageNumber - the page number for this page. The page number for first page is 1, the second page is 2, and so on.
        pageLength - maximum number of lines for this page. Set null for unlimited lines in this page.

        Get maximum number of lines for this page.
        Returns:
        maximum number of lines for this page.

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Check if this page is full and no new line can be written anymore.
        Returns:
        true if this page is full and no write operation is supported, or false if this page is not full.

      • isOverflow

        public boolean isOverflow()
        Check if this page is overflow. The difference with this method and isFull() is that this method will return true only if number of lines is more than allowed length.
        Returns:
        true if this page is overflowed or false if otherwise.

      • append

        public void append(java.lang.String text)
        Add a new line to this page from a string. The string will be converted to a line. See also append(Line).
        Parameters:
        text - the string that will be added to this page.

      • append

        public void append(Line line)
        Add a new line to this page. The line will be inserted after the last line of this page.
        Parameters:
        line - the line that will be added to this page.

      • append

        public void append(java.util.List<? extends Line> lines)
        Add multipe lines to this page. The lines will be inserted after the last line of this page.
        Parameters:
        lines - the lines that will be added to this page.

      • appendEmptyLine

        public void appendEmptyLine()
        Add empty line to this page.

      • appendEmptyLineUntil

        public void appendEmptyLineUntil(int lineNumber)
        Add empty lines from current line to the specified line number.
        Parameters:
        lineNumber - destination line number. This line is exclusive (the lines before this line will be empty line but not including this line).

      • insert

        public Line insert(Line line,
          int lineNumber)
        Insert a new Line at the specified lineNumber position. If the page is full after insertion, the last line of the content (not including footer) will be removed and returned.
        Parameters:
        line - the Line that will be inserted.
        lineNumber - the line number position in which the new line will be inserted.
        Returns:
        discarded Line if insertion causes overflow and a line is removed, or null if no line is discarded.

      • setLine

        public void setLine(int lineNumber,
           Line line)
        Change the content of a line. Line number for the first line (starting from header) is 1.
        Parameters:
        lineNumber - the line number position in which the new line will be replaced.
        line - a new line to replace old line.

      • getNumberOfLines

        public int getNumberOfLines()
        Get current number of lines in this page that have been written.
        Returns:
        number of lines of this page (excluding empty lines).

      • getLines

        public Line[] getLines()
        Get all lines in this page.
        Returns:
        all lines of this page (excluding empty lines).

      • getLine

        public Line getLine(int lineNumber)
        Get the text of certain line number in this page.
        Parameters:
        lineNumber - a line number starting from 1.
        Returns:
        the text for the specified line number.

      • removeLine

        public boolean removeLine(Line line)
        Remove a Line from this Page.
        Parameters:
        line - a Line that will be removed.
        Returns:
        true if this page contained the specified line

      • removeLine

        public Line removeLine(int lineNumber)
        Remove a Line by its line number. This method will only delete line located at detail (content). Header and footer can't be deleted by using this method.
        Parameters:
        lineNumber - a line number starting from 1 starting from header (if exists). The line number should not be part of header or footer.
        Returns:
        the deleted Line or null if nothing is deleted.

      • convertToString

        public java.lang.String convertToString(boolean autoLinefeed,
                               boolean autoFormfeed)
        Convert this page into ESC/P string that can be printed. This is >not including filling operation to substitute placeholder with values from data source or evaluating functions.
        Parameters:
        autoLinefeed - set true if auto line-feed is enabled (CR will be used as line separator) or set false if auto line-feed is disabled (CRLR will be used as line separator).
        autoFormfeed - set true if auto form-feed is enabled (CRFF will be added automatically at the end of page) or set false to not add CRFF automatically at the end of page.
        Returns:
        conversion result that may contains ESC/P string.

      • hasDynamicLine

        public boolean hasDynamicLine()
        Check if this page contains one or more dynamic lines.
        Returns:
        true if this page contains dynamic line or false if otherwise.

      • getTableLines

        public java.util.List<TableLine> getTableLines()
        Get all TableLine in this page. This method also stores line number for each returned TableLine. To inspect line number for TableLine, use TableLine.getLineNumber() method.
        Returns:
        List that contains TableLine in this page. If no TableLine exists in this page, it will return an empty List.

      • getListLines

        public java.util.List<ListLine> getListLines()
        Get all ListLine in this page. This method also stores line number for each returned ListLine. To inspect line number for ListLine, use ListLine.getLineNumber() method.
        Returns:
        List that contains TableLine in this page. If no TableLine exists in this page, it will return an empty List.
